channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: What to know about Sen. Katie Britt, who's negotiating changes to how ICE operates
item.description: Alabama Sen. Katie Britt came to national prominence in 2024 with an image as a firebrand on the right but has developed a reputation as a bipartisan deal maker in the Senate.
item.content:encoded: Alabama Sen. Katie Britt came to national prominence in 2024 with an image as a firebrand on the right but has developed a reputation as a bipartisan deal maker in the Senate.
item.dc:creator: Sam Gringlas

item.title: The market for tariff refunds
item.description: Well before the Supreme Court struck down many of President Trump's tariffs, Wall Street had been literally betting on it. Firms created a market to sell companies' claims on refunds, if they happen.
item.content:encoded: Well before the Supreme Court struck down many of President Trump's tariffs, Wall Street had been literally betting on it. Firms created a market to sell companies' claims on refunds, if they happen.
item.dc:creator: Mary Childs

item.title: 'Bridgerton' is back: Head downstairs to meet this season's love interest
item.description: Bridgerton continues to enthrall fans. This season, Yerin Ha stars as Sophie Baek in a Cinderella-coded story.
item.content:encoded: Bridgerton continues to enthrall fans. This season, Yerin Ha stars as Sophie Baek in a Cinderella-coded story.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: Decades after being blocked from the Little League World Series, a Black team is honored
item.description: A Black little league team that got invited to the 1963 Little League World Series but never got to go because of segregation is finally getting recognition.
item.content:encoded: A Black little league team that got invited to the 1963 Little League World Series but never got to go because of segregation is finally getting recognition.
item.dc:creator: Julien Virgin

item.title: Supreme Court appears split in tax foreclosure case
item.description: At issue is whether a county can seize homeowners' residence for unpaid property taxes and sell the house at auction for less than the homeowners would get if they put their home on the market themselves.
item.content:encoded:
At issue is whether a county can seize homeowners' residence for unpaid property taxes and sell the house at auction for less than the homeowners would get if they put their home on the market themselves. 

(Image credit: Heather Diehl)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Every month in Baker, Nev., people come out for a full moon hike
item.description: Among the cattle ranches and stretches of desert of Eastern Nevada, there aren't a lot of social events. But there is a full moon hike every month in the tiny town of Baker.
item.content:encoded: Among the cattle ranches and stretches of desert of Eastern Nevada, there aren't a lot of social events. But there is a full moon hike every month in the tiny town of Baker.
item.dc:creator: Fil Corbitt

item.title: After an avalanche, investigations look at more than just snow conditions
item.description: When a fatal avalanche happens, what's the process that officials use to analyze a particular event and learn from it?
item.content:encoded: When a fatal avalanche happens, what's the process that officials use to analyze a particular event and learn from it?
item.dc:creator: Ezra D Romero

item.title: FBI Director Kash Patel faces scrutiny over travel on government jet
item.description: Democrats and others are raising questions about FBI Director Kash Patel's travel on a taxpayer-funded plane.
item.content:encoded: Democrats and others are raising questions about FBI Director Kash Patel's travel on a taxpayer-funded plane.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: With help from monkeys, scientists build a leaner AI brain
item.description: Scientists have created an AI version of a monkey brain that recognizes images without requiring the massive computing power of existing AI systems.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have created an AI version of a monkey brain that recognizes images without requiring the massive computing power of existing AI systems.
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: Ukraine's ambassador to the U.S. on power outages, resilience and peace
item.description: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Ukraine's Ambassador to the United States as Russia's war with Ukraine stretches into a fifth year.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mary Louise Kelly speaks with Ukraine's Ambassador to the United States as Russia's war with Ukraine stretches into a fifth year.
item.dc:creator: Courtney Dorning
